edu.cpp.cs.cs141.gp

Class Map

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.gp.Map
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Map
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    The Map class creates a 9x9 grid. First this grid is made up of empty positions, and next the rooms are positioned at a specific location on the grid. Also places the various items on the grid along with the briefcase and enemies. Both the starting location and vision of the player are set in this class.
    Author:
    Pink Panthers
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void checkItemPlayerPositions(int nextPlayerRow, int nextPlayerCol)
      This method uses integers nextPlayerRow and nextPlayerCol to check if a player is coming up to an item, and if the player is, then isItem is set to true.
      void createMap()
      This method uses emptyPositions() and createRooms() to create the map.
      void createRooms()
      This method uses position to create rooms (denoted by the integer 1) in the desired spaces: with the rows and columns being the combinations of 1, 4, and 7.
      void emptyPositions()
      This method initially sets all of the values in the position array to 2, which is empty.
      int getBriefcaseCol()
      This method returns the column that the briefcase is positioned at
      int getBriefcaseRow()
      This method returns the row that the briefcase is positioned at
      boolean getIsItem()
      This method returns whether an item is next to the user, making it so that the user is able to pick up the item.
      boolean getIsTaken(int row, int col)
      This method returns whether a space on the grid is taken by any of the following: a room, a player, an enemy, the briefcase, and the items.
      int[][] getPositionVal()
      This method returns position which is used for the map's display.
      int getPositionValue(int row, int col)
      This method returns the value of the specified position in position.
      boolean[][] getVision()
      This method returns the set value of the boolean isDark.
      void isTaken()
      This method checks the values of position to the fill the isTaken array with boolean values.
      void placeBriefCase(int row, int col)
      This method saves the integers row and col to briefCaseRow and briefCaseCol, respectively, and then places the briefcase in position, which is denoted by the integer 8.
      void placeEnemy(int row, int col)
      This method sets the position to the enemy's value, 3.
      void placeItem(int row, int col, int itemID)
      This method breaks up the three items that are placed on the map into three different cases: invulnerability (5), radar (6), and ammo (7) into position.
      void placePlayer(int row, int col)
      The placePlayer method takes the player's coordinates as arguments and uses them to save it into @playerRow and playerCol and sets the corresponding coordinates in the position array to 4.
      void resetPosition(int row, int col)
      This method is used for clearing the previous position to empty (2).
      void setPlayerVision(boolean look, int direction)
      This method uses the boolean look and int direction to create the appropriate vision.
      void setVision()
      This method sets the darkness of the building.

    • Field Detail

      • position

        private int[][] position
        This field holds the different integer identifiers for all the different possible things that can be held on the map, including emptiness. It is primarily used for display. 1 Room, 2 Empty, 3 Enemy, 4 Player, 5-7 Item, 8 Briefcase

      • isTaken

        private boolean[][] isTaken
        This field holds boolean values that correspond to those of position. If the space is occupied, it is true, else it is false.

      • isDark

        private boolean[][] isDark
        This field holds boolean values for printing the player's vision, which is determined in setVision() and setPlayerVision(boolean, int).

      • playerRow

        private int playerRow
        These fields hold the player's row and column positions. It is saved in placePlayer(int, int), and it is used to set the player's vision and for look in setPlayerVision(boolean, int).

      • playerCol

        private int playerCol
        These fields hold the player's row and column positions. It is saved in placePlayer(int, int), and it is used to set the player's vision and for look in setPlayerVision(boolean, int).

      • briefCaseRow

        private int briefCaseRow
        These fields hold the briefcase's row and column positions. It is saved in placeBriefCase(int, int)

      • briefCaseCol

        private int briefCaseCol
        These fields hold the briefcase's row and column positions. It is saved in placeBriefCase(int, int)

      • isItem

        private boolean isItem
        This field represents whether there is an item in the given position or not. It is used in checkItemPlayerPositions(int, int) and can be retrieved with getIsItem().

    • Constructor Detail

      • Map

        public Map()

    • Method Detail

      • emptyPositions

        public void emptyPositions()
        This method initially sets all of the values in the position array to 2, which is empty.

      • createRooms

        public void createRooms()
        This method uses position to create rooms (denoted by the integer 1) in the desired spaces: with the rows and columns being the combinations of 1, 4, and 7.

      • placeBriefCase

        public void placeBriefCase(int row,
                           int col)
        This method saves the integers row and col to briefCaseRow and briefCaseCol, respectively, and then places the briefcase in position, which is denoted by the integer 8.
        Parameters:
        row - int that corresponds with R(or x)
        col - int that corresponds with C(or y)

      • placeItem

        public void placeItem(int row,
                      int col,
                      int itemID)
        This method breaks up the three items that are placed on the map into three different cases: invulnerability (5), radar (6), and ammo (7) into position.
        Parameters:
        row - int that corresponds with R(or x)
        col - int that corresponds with C(or y)
        itemID - int that corresponds with the type of item. (0) invuln, (1) radar, (2) ammo

      • placePlayer

        public void placePlayer(int row,
                        int col)
        The placePlayer method takes the player's coordinates as arguments and uses them to save it into @playerRow and playerCol and sets the corresponding coordinates in the position array to 4.
        Parameters:
        row - int that corresponds with R(or x)
        col - int that corresponds with C(or y)

      • placeEnemy

        public void placeEnemy(int row,
                       int col)
        This method sets the position to the enemy's value, 3.
        Parameters:
        row - int that corresponds with R(or x)
        col - int that corresponds with C(or y)

      • createMap

        public void createMap()
        This method uses emptyPositions() and createRooms() to create the map.

      • setVision

        public void setVision()
        This method sets the darkness of the building. If position is a room (1), the value of the isDark is always false. It also calls setPlayerVision(boolean, int).

      • setPlayerVision

        public void setPlayerVision(boolean look,
                            int direction)
        This method uses the boolean look and int direction to create the appropriate vision. If the look is false, then the player has normal vision; that is, the player can only see 1 space adjacent in all four directions. If look is true, then there is also a direction 1-4 passed, and it will increase the vision to 1 more square.
        Parameters:
        look - boolean, determines whether the player chose the action to look ahead one extra space or not
        direction - int, determines the direction the player chose to look in

      • isTaken

        public void isTaken()
        This method checks the values of position to the fill the isTaken array with boolean values. As long as it is not empty, the value will be true.

      • resetPosition

        public void resetPosition(int row,
                          int col)
        This method is used for clearing the previous position to empty (2).
        Parameters:
        row - the desired row position to be cleared
        col - the desired column position

      • checkItemPlayerPositions

        public void checkItemPlayerPositions(int nextPlayerRow,
                                     int nextPlayerCol)
        This method uses integers nextPlayerRow and nextPlayerCol to check if a player is coming up to an item, and if the player is, then isItem is set to true.
        Parameters:
        nextPlayerRow - int used to check the row position
        nextPlayerCol - int used to check the column position

      • getPositionVal

        public int[][] getPositionVal()
        This method returns position which is used for the map's display.
        Returns:
        position

      • getPositionValue

        public int getPositionValue(int row,
                            int col)
        This method returns the value of the specified position in position. This is used for player movement.
        Parameters:
        row - int of row
        col - int of column
        Returns:
        position

      • getBriefcaseRow

        public int getBriefcaseRow()
        This method returns the row that the briefcase is positioned at
        Returns:
        int briefCaseRow

      • getBriefcaseCol

        public int getBriefcaseCol()
        This method returns the column that the briefcase is positioned at
        Returns:
        int briefCaseCol

      • getIsTaken

        public boolean getIsTaken(int row,
                          int col)
        This method returns whether a space on the grid is taken by any of the following: a room, a player, an enemy, the briefcase, and the items.
        Parameters:
        row - int used to x coordinate in the isTaken array
        col - int used to y coordinate in the isTaken array
        Returns:
        isTaken the value of the corresponding position in the isTaken array

      • getIsItem

        public boolean getIsItem()
        This method returns whether an item is next to the user, making it so that the user is able to pick up the item.
        Returns:
        isItem value true for when an item is one spot from the player. Otherwise false.

      • getVision

        public boolean[][] getVision()
        This method returns the set value of the boolean isDark.
        Returns:
        the array isDark
